alert.note: Alert for Bladen; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 2:39PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern New Hanover, southern Pender, southeastern Bladen, northeastern Brunswick and east central Columbus Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 238 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rocky Point, or 7 miles south of Burgaw, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Burgaw, Hampstead, Northwest, Topsail Beach, Point Caswell, Long Creek, Cape Fear Community College North Campus, Montague, Rooks, Malpass Corner, Ashton, Rocky Point, Topsail, Currie, Castle Hayne, The Borough, Phoenix, Delco, Riegelwood and Woodside. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 401 and 416. Interstate 140 between mile markers 15 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Bladen; Coastal Pender; Columbus; Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover; Inland Pender
